title: How Recode's Shark Tank Rejection Boosted Its Growth ? - Indian Retailer
summary: The article discusses how Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) brands in India are preparing for the festive season by ramping up product offerings, revamping supply chain networks, and integrating technology to drive sales amid a surge in consumer spending and travel.
green_innovation: FALSE. The article does not primarily focus on innovations that specifically target environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article describes how brands are introducing new products and improving their business processes to attract customers during the festive season.
green_product: TRUE. The article highlights several brands offering sustainable and eco-friendly products like recycled footwear, India-inspired bags, and skincare products, all designed to reduce environmental impact.
green_process: FALSE. The article mentions improvements in supply chain networks and technology integration, but it does not emphasize processes that minimize environmental impacts.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 454110 (Electronic Shopping and Mail-Order Houses), 448150 (Clothing Accessories Stores), 424130 (Industrial and Personal Service Paper Merchant Wholesalers), 454111 (Electronic Shopping)
greenwashing: FALSE. The article focuses on genuine efforts by brands to meet customer demands and drive sales during the festive season, rather than deceptive environmental marketing tactics.

title: SS Beauty to Bank on Aggressive Omnichannel Model, to reach 25 Doors by Next Fiscal: Biju Kassim, President ... - Indian Retailer
summary: The article discusses the growth and future plans of several beauty and personal care brands in India, highlighting achievements, expansion strategies, and product innovations.
green_innovation: FALSE, The article primarily focuses on the growth and development of various beauty and personal care brands without emphasizing specific environmental sustainability goals or green innovations.
business_innovation: TRUE, The article discusses new strategies, store expansions, product innovations, and growth plans of beauty and personal care brands, representing business innovations within the industry.
green_product: TRUE, The article showcases brands focusing on sustainable practices, vegan products, recyclable packaging, and reducing environmental impacts, aligning with the definition of green products.
green_process: TRUE, The article mentions brands emphasizing eco-friendly practices, waste reduction, energy efficiency, and using natural ingredients, indicating a focus on green processes.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325620 Toilet Preparation Manufacturing, 325611 Soap and Other Detergent Manufacturing, 446120 Cosmetics, Beauty Supplies, and Perfume Stores, 446130 Optical Goods Stores
greenwashing: FALSE, The article showcases genuine efforts by beauty and personal care brands to implement sustainable practices and environmentally friendly initiatives without presenting false claims or misleading information, thus not indicative of greenwashing.
